phrases.text: Con cò cò bay lả lả lả bay la
phrases.english: classifier (animals) egret/heron egret/heron fly wilt wilt wilt fly shout/yell

culturalContext.description: As the opening phrase, this establishes the song's emotional tone and invites audience engagement.
facts: Northern Vietnamese music is characterized by refined, softer dynamics, high tessitura
Opening phrases in Vietnamese folk songs often use vocatives (ơi, này) to grab attention before the narrative begins
Vietnamese musical phrases typically follow speech tone patterns - rising tones matched with rising pitches
The pentatonic scale (5-note) is fundamental to Vietnamese folk music, avoiding Western semitone tensions
culturalContext.musicalContext: As the opening phrase, it establishes the tonal center and introduces the melodic motif that will be varied throughout.

phrases.english: fly from from door lord house

culturalContext.description: This narrative phrase contributes to the song's narrative structure and emotional arc, typical of Northern folk traditions.
facts: Northern Vietnamese music is characterized by refined, softer dynamics, high tessitura
Vietnamese musical phrases typically follow speech tone patterns - rising tones matched with rising pitches
The pentatonic scale (5-note) is fundamental to Vietnamese folk music, avoiding Western semitone tensions
Đàn tranh (16-string zither) arrangements of folk songs are 20th century innovations - originals were vocal
culturalContext.musicalContext: The 5-syllable structure (lục bát's "lục" variant) adds weight and conclusion, often used at phrase endings.

culturalContext.musicalContext: The 5-syllable structure (lục bát's "lục" variant) adds weight and conclusion, often used at phrase endings. Positioned at the song's midpoint, this phrase likely marks a structural pivot or climax in the narrative.

culturalContext.description: This narrative phrase contributes to the song's narrative structure and emotional arc, typical of Northern folk traditions.
facts: Northern Vietnamese music is characterized by refined, softer dynamics, high tessitura
Vietnamese musical phrases typically follow speech tone patterns - rising tones matched with rising pitches
The pentatonic scale (5-note) is fundamental to Vietnamese folk music, avoiding Western semitone tensions
Đàn tranh (16-string zither) arrangements of folk songs are 20th century innovations - originals were vocal
culturalContext.musicalContext: The 6-syllable structure (song lục) balances melody with text, common in Southern traditions.

phrases.text: Duyên mình rằng duyên mình ơi rằng có biết biết hay không rằng có nhớ nhớ hay không
phrases.english: fate oneself Rang (name) fate oneself oh Rang (name) have/there is know know or/know not/no Rang (name) have/there is remember/miss remember/miss or/know not/no

culturalContext.description: This phrase invokes "duyên" (fate/destiny), a Buddhist concept deeply embedded in Vietnamese views on relationships. Vietnamese believe marriages are predetermined by karma from past lives. As the closing phrase, this provides resolution and often returns to opening themes for circular structure.
facts: Vietnamese distinguish "duyên" (destined connection) from "tình" (feeling/love) - you can have duyên without tình and vice versa
"Duyên trời định, tình tự trao" (Fate is heaven-ordained, feelings we bestow ourselves) is a common Vietnamese saying
Northern Vietnamese music is characterized by refined, softer dynamics, high tessitura
Vietnamese musical phrases typically follow speech tone patterns - rising tones matched with rising pitches
culturalContext.musicalContext: As the closing phrase, it typically returns to the tonic note and may quote the opening melody for circular structure. Exclamatory phrases often use sustained notes or melismatic ornaments (grace notes, bends) to heighten emotional intensity.
